Kyle Bryenton 2023-04-04

Here are the results for the molecular C6 benchmark, as shown in Table 2. 

For the non-XDM methods, the C6 and alpha are outputted for each atom. These were then combined using the slater kirkwood formulae to get the C6_{ij} values.

For XDM, the C6_{ij}s were outputted directly. The first column is i, the second column is j, and the 3rd column is C6_ij. The remainder of the columns are C8, C10, Rc, and Rvdw.

Results breakdown:

					benzene   	 			butane   				butene   	 			CCl4   	 				Cl2   					CO2   	 				ethane   	 			ethene   				ethyne   	 			H2   	 				hexane   				methane   	 			N2   				O2   					pentane   	 			propane   	 			propene   				SF6   	 				SiF4   	 				SiH4   	 				MAPEs
PBE-Tight_MBD-NL   	1633.9590452636298   	1295.8049696633725   	1106.4447373755622   	1975.225827237487   	364.3122494168264   	137.01468387923592   	368.535405146739   		275.06144151129365   	192.86013867778755   	9.484495626788721   	2783.7202959944702   	121.6487176064204   	75.2683683173794   	54.484038961451   		1969.6088611500538   	762.3413542290027   	617.6233217913226   	706.3225434375225   	382.8753770406271   	339.19431399277664   	7.34%
